zone.line: what loathsome shifts must I be
driven? And yet a whole life of false-
hood was otherwise my portion: and
when remorse at being the contriver of
any cheat made me shrink from my
design I was irrisistably led back and
confirmed in it by the visit of some
at Aunt or cousin, who would tell me
that death was the end of all men.
And then say that my father had sure
ly lost his wits ever since my mother’s
death; that he was mad and that I
was fortunate, for in one of his fits
he might have killed me instead of
destroying his own crazed being. And all
this, to be sure, was delicately put; not
in broad words for my feelings might
be hurt but in far
Whispered so and so
In dark hint soft and low X
with downcast eyes, and sympathizing
XColeridge’s Fire, Famine and Slaughter.
